reviews.review: Игра отличная со второй частью не сравниться,атмосфера на уровне. Первый раз проходил в сингле всю компанию на кортах =) Сейчас с друзьями рубимся на уровне Мастер, ощущения от игры незабываемые, стоит купить. P.S  оценка 9 из 10.

The game that made me a Steam player.  I have a lot of fond memories with shooters online, but this may be the best.  Until this game, I had never really found a co-op shooter that pulled me in, but I quickly logged in 100+ hours of online play and had a blast.  The achievement system, the stats, the friend community... like I said, this is the game that made me a Steam player, not Half-Life.  I'd also like to think it's the reason why zombie games are a dime a dozen now.  Some of these games were in development before The Walking Dead made it big on TV, because everyone found out how much fun it is to blast zombie in the face with a shotgun in a game with Left 4 Dead!
Its 1 good game and has good graphics.
Great co op action fps. Shoot some zombies in the face!
This game is a classic... Nothing can replace the fun of playing it with friends. It's 5x better than playing with randoms!

Left 4 Dead has different modes including a campaign mode where a "story" of a group of 4 people's struggle to survive in the zombie apocalypse. There are also other forms of multiplier that get interesting, but sometimes servers are hard to fill up. All of the maps are included in L4D2 but if you really want to experience the classic game this is the only way to, as the had modified the maps a bit in L4D2. I've met some great people over the game and its a game I will enjoy for a long time. Definitely a 8/10 for me.

Absolutely solid game that doesn't try to pretend it's not just that - a game. Valve puts intense labors of love in creating a believable, logical, and eerily gorgeous setting, then piles stashes of health packs and unrealistic armories of guns and ammo... and it feels fantastic. Can be played both casually with no regard to story or characters alongside other players paying close attention to the world-building details of the world and the quirks of each individual player character, with full satisfaction on each end.

So good on XBawks I bought it on Steam too, and never regretted it.

I am a bit of a zombie fan boy, and this is one of the few zombie games that i like, the game play is simple yet effective and the story is fun although a little repetitive. it is mostly go thought the level/chapter and activate something important, be that as it may you only really realize this once you have finished the game. it offers hours of fun and its one of those games you can go back to after you have finished it. online is a thing i mostly have problems with, mainly because i don't do to well with actual people (or npc's for that matter) but it was fun for the beef time that i had played played. i haven't played this game in a while but looling back on it i might start to play it again. i do recommend this game and would rat it a 5/10

The key to this game is always reload! You won't have much time to breathe when you have a hoard of zombies coming at ya.. oh and lets not forget the specials like Tanks,hunters, and witches! 

Very fun game you can be stuck playing for hours on end. Big servers with 20 people deep make it a bit more exciting join those and watch the crazyness!

Left 4 Dead is a game that does CO-OP gameplay right. You rely on your team as a whole to surbibe especially on expert mode. For a zombie game it is also top tier no bad third person camera angles like Resident Evil. One of the best FPS's I've ever played without a doubt. If you dont own it pick up the Left 4 Dead bundle that includes the sequel you wont regret it. And if you love VALVE consider picking up the VALVE bundle which includes a ton of games to keep you busy

Obligatory header to the review: I focus on four primary areas whenever I review a game: gameplay, story, graphics, and sound/audio/general things that go into your earholes. Gameplay and Story get a rating scale from 1 to 10, and the AV stuff gets a rating from 1 to 5. My philosophy on this is that there are some instances in which a game may not necessarily have that much in the way of gameplay (take Amnesia for example), but the story/atmosphere/whatever it may be is reason enough to pick it up. Also, take the cumulative score with a grain of salt; it's just a numerical feeling about the game as a whole. That's part of why I do these subscores. Also, keep in mind that I'm not going off of school grade based rankings. A 5/10 denotes what I feel to be an average game. Likewise, 7/10 is a game that I think is pretty cool, and something that gets a 2/10 is near-abomination level. Pinning scores to an even further obfuscated rating scale is kinda senseless, but for the sake of my backloggery, I'll repeat again that 1.0-2.7 is a one-star game, 3.0-4.7 is a two-star game, 5.0-6.7, 7.0-8.7, and 9.0-10 are three, four, and five stars, respectively.

Gameplay: Truth be told, I probably shouldn't even bother writing a review for this game. If you're here and you're reading this, then you most likely already have an opinion on the game. Nevertheless, I've been told quite often that just writing for writing's sakes isn't harmful; rather, the opposite. So here I am, talking about a remarkably popular series and giving my two cents amidst the stream of million dollar bills or something i dunno thought i'd try a metaphor

Left 4 Dead is a game about zombies. Many zombies. Specifically the 28 Days Later kind of zombies that can tear it through areas. There's also quite a few of them; roughly the amount you'd expect from a Serious Sam game or another game in its ilk. I love me some Serious Sam, so this is definitely a perk. I didn't have the fortune of playing with friends, and since I'd prefer not to potentially deal with the most cretin-like of online players, I kept to single player for all six campaigns. Your partners have pretty good AI, although they do seem to get a bit confused whenever you're making your escape. 

One thing that I wasn't too much of a fan of as far as the gameplay feel - although I do recognize it as a function of the game's design - is that all of the campaigns feel pretty much the same. They all have a few sections of shooting many zombies followed by holding out for "ten minutes" while some sort of rescue arrives. I put ten minutes in quotes because there have been many a time where ten minutes most certainly had not passed, but rescue still arrives. Don't get me wrong, though; the stages are still quite good and often have multiple paths that you can take through the level to get to the end, but it can get a bit repetitive at times.

One of the things that this game does in order to keep things interesting is to have certain points throughout the level where a random "special infected" can spawn; there are five special infected that can show up, with each having their own unique strategy to dealing with them. This does keep the tension at a good level, although an unfortunate spawning of a tank can kinda take you back out of it. Nevertheless, these enemies don't feel cheap, as there's always some way of dealing with them.

Again, you probably already know this, but this is certainly a game that would be a lot of fun to play with friends. The option to play as the special infected in a certain mode of multiplayer is one that again I would have liked to try, but I didn't have enough friends that owned the game for Steam. Nevertheless, even as a single player experience, I still had a lot of fun with this game. 9/10.

Story: Much like how the levels themselves are organized, the story for each individual campaign comes down to Enter Area (most commonly through breaking down of a vehicle) - Fight Zambies - Escape in New Vehicle to Soon Break Down. Obviously, the origin of the zombies and all that isn't of concern to the story. Then again, it doesn't need to be. The focus of the writing is more on the characters. It's always fun to listen in on each character's banter with the others (and about how Francis hates everything). One thing I wish they would have done for the sake of the story would be to do... something after the final campaign. It just seems weird that it just ends and puts you back at the main menu. Nevertheless, the banter is still  quite enjoyable. I still wish they had provided that closure, though. 7/10.

Graphics: Given that this is a Valve-published game, one thing that you can expect is a very well optimized game that looks quite good. This game looks quite good, even if the graphics aren't artistically timeless. I really dug the art design of the special infected; specifically the Smoker portraying the "long, shady" look that smokers are stereotyped with. The environments look quite good, even if it is a bit hard to make out what you're looking at due to how dark it can be. Also, the technical things work just fine and as well optimized as one would expect from a Valve game. It's no surprise that it runs well on my relatively high-powered graphics card at 1080p Ultra settings, but admittedly it not running on those settings on my computer would be surprising. You don't need too much stronghth (yes, that was intentional) to run this game, and I'd imagine an integrated graphics chip could run this game. Even though it may not be the nicest thing to look at in ten or so years, it still looks and works perfectly fine today. 4/5.

Sound: Most of the music in this game is very ambient, but there are a couple of actual songs in there. The ambient pieces are very good at adding to what's going on; the ghostly wailing signaling the presence of a Witch adds the right amount of tension  to make you careful, the cacophonous wails of violins signal the onslaught of common infected, and it all works quite well. Each special infected makes their own sounds, and they're all quite distinctive and useful for identifying what special infected is just around the corner. The four survivor's voice actors do a quite good job at making the characters believable. All in all the audio portion of the game is quite well put together and adds just that much more to the game. 5/5.

Overall scores are 9/7/4/5; cumulative score of 8.3/10. This will hopefully not be the last time I end up playing this game, as again, this game needs to be played with friends. It's just made for it. It can be done single player, but it's just not the same.

DO NOT play this game during/after any STEAM sale. You will find yourself on Expert mode with a full squad of people who have no clue. Like anything else in life, playing with a bunch of clueless folks can be fun in a Normal setting, but turn that up to Expert/Holiday/Combat settings and you will find yourselves dead. Vote it down to Easy and leave the new kids to learn how to play before you leave.

Ótimo jogo, gameplay altamente viciante, multiplayer despensa comentários, com amigos é diversão garantida.E aspectos técnicos, o que dizer, motor gráfico ''source'', então espere por uma física de ótima qualidade. Como visto em Half-Life, bem os modelos dos personagens, armas, objetos e cenário em geral e bem feito, com muitos detalhes que dão destaque principamente aos personagens( além de serem muito carismáticos ).
Então espero que com está análise mostre a você o quanto vale adquirir este jogo a sua biblioteca, horas e horas de gameplay garantida.

If you're gonna buy either Left 4 Dead 1 or 2, get 2, but if you can, it's definitely worth getting 1 later on.  This is still worth it, it changes the game quite a bit, and features the survival map "The Last Stand."  If you're a dedicated  fan you'll certainly notice the difference, but to the average player it may not be worth buying.
